intro: Microtropis sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered microtropis, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a climbing shrub that belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, sessile leaves and clusters of tiny, fragrant flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
